command.name: CREATE
command.operation:
sudo su touch /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg echo -e "# Generated with MSA" > /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$a#---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Global settings
#---------------------------------------------------------------------
global
 log /dev/log local0
 log /dev/log local1 notice
 daemon
" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$a#---------------------------------------------------------------------
# common defaults that all the 'listen' and 'backend'sections will
# use if not designatedin their block
#---------------------------------------------------------------------" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$adefaults
 mode http
 log global
 option httplog
 option dontlognull
 option http-server-close
 option forwardfor except 127.0.0.0/8
 option redispatch
 retries 1
 timeout http-request 10s
 timeout queue 20s
 timeout connect 5s
 timeout client 20s
 timeout server 20s
 timeout http-keep-alive 10s
 timeout check 10s
" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$a#---------------------------------------------------------------------
# apiserver frontend which proxys to the masters
#---------------------------------------------------------------------" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$afrontend apiserver
 bind *:6443
 mode tcp
 option tcplog
 default_backend apiserver
" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$a#---------------------------------------------------------------------
# round robin balancing for apiserver
#---------------------------------------------------------------------" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg sed -i "\$abackend apiserver
 option httpchk GET /healthz
 http-check expect status 200
 mode tcp
 option ssl-hello-chk
 balance roundrobin
 server k8s-node-1 {$params.k8s_m_1_ip}:6443 check
 server k8s-node-2 {$params.k8s_m_2_ip}:6443 check
 # [...]
" /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg service haproxy restart
